summary: This document is an email chain from March 2016 discussing Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women as reported by Page Six, and includes an earlier email from February 29, 2016, where an attorney shares legal documents related to a defamation case against Ghislaine Maxwell and a CVRA case, noting a motion to dismiss was denied.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a Page Six article about his continued relationships with young women and his East Side mansion housing 'Russian playmates'.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of a defamation case; her motion to dismiss was denied by Judge Sweet.

persons.name: Pete
persons.context: Sent an email sharing a Page Six article about Jeffrey Epstein's relationships with young women.

persons.name: Peter Skinner
persons.context: Sent an email adding someone to an email chain, mentioning a lead attorney on the case who knows the facts well.

persons.name: Amanda Kramer
persons.context: Recipient of an email from Peter Skinner discussing case details and attorneys.

persons.name: Judge Sweet
persons.context: Denied Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in the defamation case.

connections.description: Both are central figures in legal cases discussed; Maxwell is involved in a defamation case related to Epstein's activities.
Skinner emails Kramer to discuss case details and include other attorneys in follow-ups.

events.title: Page Six Reports on Epstein's Relationships
events.description: Page Six publishes an article about Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women and his East Side mansion housing 'Russian playmates'.

events.title: Motion to Dismiss Denied in Maxwell Defamation Case
events.description: Judge Sweet denies Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in a defamation case against her.

events.title: Legal Documents Shared
events.description: An attorney shares legal documents including a complaint in a defamation case against Maxwell, declarations in a CVRA case, a Rule 56.1 statement, and a redacted 302.

keyFacts: A Page Six article from March 8, 2016, reports on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women, specifically mentioning his East Side mansion housing 'Russian playmates'.
On February 29, 2016, Judge Sweet denied Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in a defamation case against her.

Legal documents shared in the email include a complaint in the defamation case against Maxwell, declarations in a CVRA case, a Rule 56.1 statement, and a redacted 302, indicating ongoing legal proceedings related to Epstein and Maxwell.
